detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: PHYS 409: PREREQUISITE: PHYSICS 309 OR 319.  Phys 409A is a three credit course. It has two laboratory sessions each week for one term.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: PHYS 410 has a large overlap with MATH 405, and students are advised to choose one or the other.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
PHYS 420-C is a Winter Terms 1-2 course.
This course will meet In-Person in Winter T1 (September-December), on Wednesdays, 2pm-4pm in Hebb 212. Students MUST ensure they have NO conflict in their T1 timetables during this slot.

This course has no regular meetings or location in Winter T2 (January-April); students will present demonstrations at local schools in T2.

Minimum 68% cumulative average required to be allowed in the course. Students who do not meet the requirement will be removed from the course before course starts.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: REGISTRATION REQUIRES DEPARTMENTAL APPROVAL. INTERESTED STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE DEPARTMENTAL ADVISOR IN ORDER TO REGISTER.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This is an Honours Thesis course.

instances.text: POLI_V 420-B_001 - Advanced Topics in Comparative Politics (B)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course will take place in Buchanan C403.

We are currently facing an unexpected seat shortage in our 400-level POLI seminars and are actively working to find seminar options for POLI Majors, Combined Majors, and Honours students who plan to graduate in May 2025. If you are in this affected group but have not been able to register for a seminar or need additional information about the 2024W seminar seat allocation process, please review this recent announcement from our advising team on our Undergraduate Info Hub. (Current POLI students should be able to access the Info Hub via their Canvas homepage. If you don't have access to the Info Hub, you can enroll here.)
For more detailed information about courses, including descriptions and instructor profiles, visit the POLI course app at: https://poli-2024w-courses.glide.page.

detailResultFields.value:
Those interested in registering for POLI448 are asked to contact Prof. Afsahi (afsoun.afsahi@ubc.ca) with a screenshot of their grades and a sample of writing preferably from a class in political theory by June 21st.

This course will take place in Buchanan C403.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
If you have any difficulty registering in POLI courses, including if you are blocked from registering due to Pre-requisites or Year Standing restrictions, please email us at poli.ugrad@ubc.ca. 
We are closely monitoring this email during regular business hours to respond quickly to inquiries and to assist with registration requests. 
For more detailed information about courses, including descriptions and instructor profiles, visit the POLI course app at: https://poli-2024w-courses.glide.page.

instances.text: PSYC_V 488-B_001 - Directed Studies in Behavioural Neuroscience (B)
PSYC_V 488-E_003 - Directed Studies in Behavioural Neuroscience (E)
RMST_V 402-101 - Visions of Nature and the Environment in the Romance World

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Pre-modern Europe produced a vast corpus of texts and images that mirror and teach an organic way of thinking and of becoming. Explore readings in contemporary environmental humanities, and in (mostly) North-American Indigenous perspectives on education as path to wholeness.  
 
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst402   

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 419-101 - Studies in Romance Languages and Literature

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Translation and Romance Languages: This course examines translation in the framework of cross­-cultural and multi­disciplinary comparisons, with an emphasis on Romance languages. We will look at the history of translation, and analyze translators and interpreters as fictional characters in literature and film.
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst419/      

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 452-101 - Italian Cinema and Its Cultural Background

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Explore the great masters of Italian cinema after the Neorealist Age.  
ITAL 430 and RMST 452 are the same course. Please register as RMST 452. 

View full description.  

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
From exile to ecstasy, from wretchedness to reintegration, the Divine Comedy is a story of inner transmutation, whose liberating power has touched countless readers over the ages and across cultures.  
ITAL 403 and RMST 453 are taught in the same classroom at the same time by the same instructor. All students must register in RMST 453. Both courses fulfill the literature requirement for the Faculty of Arts.

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/RMST453     

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
